title: Day of AI curriculum meets the moment
summary: MIT Responsible AI for Social Empowerment and Education (RAISE) celebrated the second annual Day of AI with two flagship events. The events focused on human rights, data policy, and student workshops. Participation in Day of AI has more than doubled since its inaugural year, with over 8,000 registrations across all 50 U.S. states and 108 countries. The curriculum included new modules on topics like AI in school, social media, and data science. The event emphasized the importance of responsible AI use and the need for inclusive development processes. The program also addressed concerns about AI's impact on privacy, learning, addiction, and job displacement. Amazon Future Engineer collaborated with MIT to provide hands-on activities for students. The Day of AI program was also adapted in Australia, reaching 85,000 students and sparking interest in AI education. The event aims to empower students to shape the future of AI and ensure its accessibility and ethical use.
